sect2.title: Get the latest HPCC Virtual Image File
sect2.para: The complete details for installing and running HPCC in a virtual machine are available in the document: Running HPCC in a Virtual Machine, available from http://hpccsystems.com/download/docs .
The following steps are a quick summary, assuming you have some familiarity with running virtual machines.

listitem.para: Download the latest HPCC Virtual Machine image file from:
Save the file to a folder on your machine.
Open your virtualization software, import the virtual machine and start it.
Once the VM initialization completes, you will see a window similar to the following:

row.entry: Your virtual IP address could be different from the ones provided in the example images. Please use the IP address provided by your installation.

listitem.para: Note the IP Address of your VM Instance.
In your browser, enter the URL displayed (circled in red above) in the previous image (without the :8010)
For Ganglia enter the IP Address/ganglia. For Nagios enter the IP Address/nagios3.
For example, http://nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn/nagios3, where nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn is your Virtual Machine's IP address displayed at the VM welcome screen.

sect2.para: We encourage experienced users to use SSH and log into the VM and further examine the configuration of a 1-node monitoring solution.
